result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on October 17, 2022 at 01:40 pm.

02:36 PM Defendant appeared.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has applied for SPD, but no one is appointed yet.  Case rescheduled.  Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
Status conference on August 1, 2022 at 02:20 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 13

02:49 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Stanley V. Woodard.  Frank John Remington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 02:20 pm.
